intro: Senecio schultzii subsp. chillaloensis, commonly known as the Chillaloensis Groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine, white coating, which helps reduce water loss. The flowers are small, yellowish, and bloom in clusters, making it a distinctive addition to its native habitat.
